title: Visit These 15 Ramen Destinations Before Winter Ends
text:
Visit These 15 Ramen Destinations Before Winter Ends All Feb 22, 2017, 4:11pm EST OISA Ramen Rachel Leah Blumenthal for Eater 
Even with signs of spring showing themselves in the weather this week, warm meals are still in fashion, and a hot bowl of ramen is the perfect option for lunch and dinner. The Metro area is a surprising treasure trove for this comforting Japanese dish, and plenty of restaurants serve a variety of bowls that should not be overlooked. These are 15 of the best around â€” some at restaurants that exclusively serve ramen, some in spots that serve a wider Japanese menu, and some hiding amongst dishes from other cuisines at non-Japanese restaurants. 
Bonus ramen: It's not a point on this map since it doesn't have a permanent location, but keep a close eye on the must-try OISA Ramen , which pops up frequently around town. Events sell out quickly. Plus, New York's acclaimed Ivan Ramen will pop up at Boston's Uni on March 6 . 
Do you have another favorite ramen spot in the area? Let us know in the comments below, or email . 
Note: Map points are arranged alphabetically, not ranked. This map will be updated periodically. 1 Ganko Ittetsu Ramen 
This tiny Coolidge Corner ramen shop opened in late 2015, hidden inside the Arcade building, and keeps to a simple four-item menu of a cucumber appetizer and three kinds of ramen: tan tan, miso, and shoyu. The restaurant garnered early praise from critics and was recognized as a top new restaurant by Boston Magazine in 2016. 318 Harvard St Ste 3 Brookline, MA 02446
